graphx - generic drawing functions¶

class pymt.graphx.DO(*args)¶
class pymt.graphx.Fbo(size=(1024, 1024), push_viewport=False)¶
bind()¶
release()¶
class pymt.graphx.GlBegin(flag)¶
class pymt.graphx.GlBlending¶

Abstraction to use blending ! Don’t use directly this class. We’ve got an alias you can use

with gx_blending:
    # do draw function
class pymt.graphx.GlDisplayList¶

Abstraction to opengl display-list usage. Here is an example of usage

dl = GlDisplayList()
with dl:
    # do draw function, like drawLabel etc...
dl.draw()
clear()¶
draw()¶
is_compiled()¶
class pymt.graphx.GlEnable(flag)¶
class pymt.graphx.GlMatrix(matrixmode=5888, do_loadidentity=False)¶

Abstraction for glPushMatrix/glPopMatrix ! Don’t use directly this class. We’ve got 2 alias: gx_matrix and gx_matrix_identity

with gx_matrix:
# do draw function
with gx_matrix_identity:
# do draw function
pymt.graphx.disable_blending()¶
pymt.graphx.drawCircle(pos=(0, 0), radius=1.0)¶
pymt.graphx.drawLabel(text, pos=(0, 0), center=True, font_size=16)¶
pymt.graphx.drawLine(points, width=5.0)¶
pymt.graphx.drawRectangle(pos=(0, 0), size=(1.0, 1.0), style=7)¶
pymt.graphx.drawRoundedRectangle(pos=(0, 0), size=(100, 50), radius=5, color=None, linewidth=1.5, precision=0.5)¶
pymt.graphx.drawTexturedRectangle(texture, pos=(0, 0), size=(1.0, 1.0))¶
pymt.graphx.drawTriangle(pos, w, h, style=4)¶
pymt.graphx.drawTrianglePoints(points, style=4)¶
pymt.graphx.enable_blending()¶
class pymt.graphx.gx_begin(flag)¶
class pymt.graphx.gx_enable(flag)¶
pymt.graphx.paintLine(points)¶
pymt.graphx.setBrush(sprite, size=10)¶
pymt.graphx.set_color(r, g, b, a=1.0)¶
